description.en: Semiotics as a method - a "semiotic turn in the study of religion" (Rober A. Yelle); semiotics as a metaphysical framework theory  - "theosemiotic" as philosophy of religion in the footsteps of Charles S. Peirce; theology in dialogue with the cultural semiotics of Juri Lotman and his pupils.
description.et: Semiootika kui meetod - "semiootiline pööre religiooniuuringutes" (Robert A. Yelle); semiootika kui metafüüsiline raamteooria - "teosemiootika" kui religioonifilosoofia Charles S. Peirce'i jälgedes; teoloogia dialoogis Juri Lotmani ja tema õpilaste kultuurisemiootikaga.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to explore and to discuss contemporary texts representing the reception of semiotics in religious studies, philosophy of religion and theology.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on ühiselt uurida ja diskuteerida kaasaegseid tekstinäiteid semiootika retseptsioonist religiooniuuringutes, religioonifilosoofias ja teoloogias.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student:
- understands the most important ways how different traditions and approaches to semiotics are used in the study of religions, in philosophy of religions and in theology
learning_outcomes.et: - orienteerub kõige põhilisemates viisides, kuidas semiootika erinevaid traditsioone ja lähenemisi religiooniuuringutes, religioonifilosoofias ja teoloogias kasutatakse

learning_outcomes.en: - discusses critically the strengths and weaknesses of these approaches
learning_outcomes.et: - arutleb kriitiliselt nende lähenemisviiside tugevuste ja nõrkuste üle

learning_outcomes.en: - is more aware about the potentials and limits of semiotics in studying and understanding religion(s)
learning_outcomes.et: - on teadlikum semiootika potentsiaalist ja piiridest religiooni(de) uurimisel ja mõistmisel

notes.en: With all questions related to the course or to the wish to write a thesis in philosophy of religion or semiotics of religion, please contact Thomas-Andreas Põder.
notes.et: With all questions related to the course or to the wish to write a thesis in philosophy of religion or semiotics of religion, please contact Thomas-Andreas Põder.

independent_work.et:
- Reading thoroughly all the texts the seminar meetings are based on (see the schedule above).
- Prepearing a short introductory presentation on one of the seminar texts (an overview about the main line of thought; formulating 2-3 questions for discussion; oral presentation: ca. 20-25 minutes).
- Writing an academic essay (the topic will be given in the last seminar; length: 5-7 pages, Times New Roman 12, space 1,5; proper academic form). Deadline: 20 June 2025.

grade_preconditions.et: Active particiption in the seminars (at least 6 times); a short introductory presentation; academic essay.

grade_evaluation.et:
- active participation in seminar meetings, incl. a short presentation: 50%.
- academic essay: 50%.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Introduction to the course. -  
To read for the seminar (ca. 25 pp.): 
(1) Thomas-Andreas Põder, "Introducing new directions in semiotic methodologies for the study of religion". In: Van Boom, J. C., Põder, T.-A. (eds.). Sign, Method and the Sacred: New directions in semiotic methodologies for the study of religion, Religion and Reason 64 / Semiotics of Religon 5, Berlin/Boston: De Gruyter, 2021, 1-25. (See Moodle) 
(2) T.-A. Põder,  The introductory section (pp. 29-33) of the chapter "Religion in the semiosphere: Theosemiotics in dialogue with Juri Lotman". In: ibid. 29-51.

To read for the seminar (ca 30 pp.):
(1) Robert Yelle, "Semiotics beyond structuralism", in R. Yelle, Semiotics of Religion. Signs of the Sacred in History, London, New York: Bloomsbury, 2013, 1-22.
(2) R. Yelle "Semiotics", in: The Oxford Handbook of the Study of Religion, M. Stausberg, Steven Engler (eds.), OUP, 2016, 208-219.

To read for the seminar (ca 32 pp.):
(1) Massimo Leone, "Semiotics in Theology and Religious Studies", in Bloomsbury Semiotics, Vol. 3, 2022, 69-80.
(2) Massimo Leone, "Semiotics of Religion: A Map", in: The Americal Journal of Semiotics, Vol. 35, Issue 3-4, 2019, 309-333.

To read for the seminar (ca 17 pp.):  
(1) Tatsuma Padoan, "On the Semiotics of Space in the Study of Religions: Theoretical Perspectives and Methodological Challenges", Van Boom, J. C., Põder, T.-A. (Eds.). Sign, Method and the Sacred: New directions in semiotic methodologies for the study of religion, 189-214.

To read for the seminar (ca 25 pp.): 
(1) Michael L. Raposa, "Prolegomena", in: Michael L. Raposa, Theosemiotic. Religion, Reading and the Gift of Meaning, New York: Fordham University Press, 2020, 1-14. 
(2) "Postlude: The Play of Musement", in: ibid.,259-264.

To read for the seminar (ca 33 pp.): 
(1) Andrew Robinson, Christopher Southgate, "A Semiotic Theology of Nature", in: Darwinism and Natural Theology: Evolving Perspectives, A. Robinson (ed.), Cambridge Scholars Publishing, 2012, 126-144. 
(2) A. Robinson, "Representation and Interpretation as the Basis of Participation in the Trinity", in: Religions, 6, 2015, 1017-1032.

To read for the seminar (ca 36 pp.): 
(1) Anthony Bartlett, "Introduction", in: A. Bartlett, Theology Beyond Metaphysics. Transformative Semiotics of Rene Girard, Eugene, Oregon: Casgade Books, 2020, xix-xxix. 
(2) A. Bartlett, "Ch. 10. The Semiotic Gospel", in: ibid., 149-174.

To read for the seminar (ca 30 pp.):
(1) T.-A. Põder, the main body (pp. 34-51) of the chapter "Religion in the semiosphere: Theosemiotics in dialogue with Juri Lotman", in: Van Boom, J.C.; Põder, T.-A. (eds), Sign, Methods and the Sacred: New directions in semiotic methodologies for the study of religion, Religion and Reason 64 / Semiotics of Religion 5, Berlin/Boston: De Gruyter, 2021, 29-51.
(2) T.-A. Põder, Matthew L. Kalkman, "Introduction: Religion in the semiosphere.  In: Sign Systems Studies, 51(2): Special issue: Religion in the semiosphere, T.-A. Põder, M. L. Kalkman (eds), 235–238. 
(3) T.-A. Põder, "Reflections on religion and the status of 'the outside' in the Lotmanian understanding of culture", in: ibid. 239-253.
